data.title: Suggestion: using OpenAL Soft on OS X

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
Following a couple tweets with Ethan (https://twitter.com/mrhelmut/status/710056044500807681), it may be interesting to update `OpenTK.dll.config` (and the future MonoGame.Framework.dll.config once OpenTK is replaced) to look for OpenAL Soft dylib instead of the OS X system library (and then push the dependencies to MonoGame/MonoKickstart, and make sure that it works on XamMac).

This would help maintaining the OpenAL implementation across the DesktopGL platforms in the future.

I've already seen the Apple implementation having differences (e.g. different return values than oal soft) and some 8-22khz sounds don't render the same than on other platforms.

data.title: DesktopGL not working anymore on OS X
data.body:
There seems to be a problem with a recent commit and Mono on OS X... it crashes at launch.

I don't know which commit did that, but Mono won't work and simply exit with the following error:

```
ERROR:    2948: DoMakeDisconnection failed with error -10860
logout
Saving session...
...copying shared history...
...saving history...truncating history files...
...completed.

```

I've already excluded recent OpenTK changes from the problem.

cc @cra0zy @dellis1972

data.title: Release 3.5
data.body: This is a merge of the latest develop changes into master for the 3.5 release.

data.title: Update ReadMe
data.body:
Just some minor modifications I thought should be done:
- mention what graphics backends platforms use, for now it's all OpenGL, but I would really like to see us use Vulkan and Metal :)
- combine submodule commands into 1
- correct command for generating platform solutions from Windows

CC. @tomspilman

data.title: Color.LerpPrecise - what does the description tell?
data.body:
Hello, I've been playing around with colors and I got to `Color.LerpPrecise`. Now the description states the following:

> Performs linear interpolation of Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color using Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.LerpPrecise(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single) on MathHelper. Less efficient but more precise compared to Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color.Lerp(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,System.Single). See remarks section of Microsoft.Xna.Framework.MathHelper.LerpPrecise(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single) on MathHelper for more info.

What did you guys mean "less efficient"? I know `LerpPrecise` ensures the color gets properly calculated but how is `Lerp` more efficient than it? I tried to search the internet for this but couldn't find much...

data.title: Support 8-bit wav as source audio
data.body:
The audio metadata put in the XNB files was incorrect.  It was based on the source audio file rather than the converted file.  This was most evident when a 8-bit wav was used as source data.

Fixes #4626.

data.title: Mouse coords in OpenTK again.
data.body:
Do not do the client bounds offset if SDL2 is being used.
Added PlatformParameters to DesktopGL platforms where the preferred OpenTK backend can be specified.  Must be set prior to construction of the Game object.

Ref: #4631

data.title: [DesktopGL] Fixed getting mouse position
data.body:
On Linux we must make sure we are not using SDL because there is a bug with SDL on getting client bounds, it's been fixed in their develop release, but it's not in stable.

CC. @KonajuGames

data.title: Revert "Fix mouse coordinate for DesktopGL and windowed mode"
data.body:
Reverts mono/MonoGame#4501

Side note, we should also get OpenTK updated, now MonoGame/opentk needs https://github.com/TD25/opentk/commit/e5ab1ae791ef07750971bc8a88e250c50cace268 from opentk/opentk.

data.title: Broken templates in Xamarin Studio. SDL.dll not found
data.body:
Hello. I've used XNA 4.0 in the past and now i have gotten some interest in creating a little game. However i've got a MacBook that i program on and would like to use the machine to create a Monogame project. I've installed the latest Mono MDK, Xamarin Studio and Monogame.

However no matter which one i choose (OpenGL or Xamarin.Mac project), **it won't run**.

I looked up on the internet for a solution to this. But none of them work. i've tried reinstalling everything multiple times. But the same error happens. The error is something like 

> SDL.dll not found

I can't give full stack trace right now though.
**How do i solve these broken templates?**

data.title: [Xamarin addin] Error on building new project
data.body:
I used the Monogame Addin for Xamarin to create a new project (Cross-Platform Desktop).
While building the unchanged project I get the error : 
    `Error MSB4066: The attribute "Conditon" in element <Import> is unrecognized.`  
for the line  
`<Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\MonoGame.Common.props"  Conditon="Exists('$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\MonoGame.Common.props')"/>`  
in the csproject file.

data.title: Windows UAP template is using an outdated SharpDX version
data.body:
I have noticed that the SharpDX libraries for Windows UAP are from the alpha release while there's a stable version since Christmas.

Would you like to update them for 3.5, or left that for a later version?

data.title: Update MonoMac, XamMac and Xamarin.Mac Support.
data.body:
This PR fixes a few issues
1. Corrects ALL the .mgcb files in the XS templates to have the correct BuildAction of MonoGameContentReference
2. Upgraded XamMac, Xamarin.Mac to use DeskopGL as it seems a better fit and works!
3. Upgraded the MonoMac + XamMac build to auto include the outputs of the Content compilation
   this will mean users no longer have to link those files manually.
   We had to do it this way because neither of those project types use MSBuild.
4. Alters the Title Container for DesktopGL so that on MacOS it will first look for the ../Resources directory (which is where BundleResource items should be) before falling back to the root directory where the app is.
5. Changes to the Reference HintPath Fixup code to make sure that for MonoMac and XamMac absolute paths are used and specific versions of OpenTK are used.
6. Fixed the MonoMac template to NOT use Nuget just like the others this is a side effect of point 5.

@mrhelmut @KonajuGames This works well on my machine could use some additional testing though. Note this should only really effect new projects.

data.title: Reordered Member to match Style and Coding guidelines
data.body: The Microsoft.XNA.Framework.Rectangle struct had the Property "Center" at the wrong location with the wrong formatting.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Filter Output bug with spritefonts
data.body:
I was missing the font in my system, and filter output wasn't giving a useful part of the error.

The log:

```
/home/harry/Content/Fonts/Interface.spritefont
    Building Font /home/harry/Content/Fonts/Monospace
    System.Exception: Could not load /home/harry/Content/Fonts/Monospace
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.FontDescriptionProcessor.Process (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.FontDescription input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) <0x40dc0710 + 0x0042f> in <filename unknown>:0 
/home/harry/Content/Fonts/Interface.spritefont: error: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.
Parameter name: index
```

Filter output:

```
Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection.
Parameter name: index
```

CC. @nkast

data.title: Can't load a new MonoGame Windows 10 UAP Project
data.body:
I have VS 2015 Update 1 on a brand new Windows 10 machine with the latest Monogame 3.4 installed.

When I try to create a new MonoGame Windows 10 UAP Project I get prompted with a message saying that I dont have the right SDK version (this error: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/porting/update-your-visual-studio-2015-rc-project-to-rtm).

Reading on forums it seems that its these two lines that are wrong in the csproj file:
    TargetPlatformVersion 10.0.10069.0 TargetPlatformVersion
    TargetPlatformMinVersion 10.0.10069.0 TargetPlatformMinVersion

Updating these to 10.0.10586.0 makes me able to load the project but I am then stuck with 197 errors waiting to be fixed.

Is this a bug in monogame, or something I have done wrong? I'm sitting here with a Lumia 950 and want to get coding :)

data.title: Use Visual Studio's registry keys...
data.body:
...to locate the project templates folder.  The templates could be anywhere, not just in the user's Documents folder.

Fixes #4612.
